us.title: Homebuilders in Freefall: Bargain Opportunity or Falling Knife?
us.content: The homebuilders sector has recently come under significant pressure, with the SPDR S&P Homebuilders ETF NYSEARCA: XHB officially entering bear market territory.

us.title: Coco Robotics Expands Uber Eats Partnership to Miami
us.content: Expansion highlights joint commitment to providing sustainable, efficient last-mile delivery solutions nationwide MIAMI , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Coco Robotics, the world's leading food delivery robotics company, announced today that it's launching operations in Miami, starting with delivery partner Uber Eats (NYSE: UBER). This announcement marks Coco's entry into the Southeast market.

us.title: Chart Of The Day: It's Tariff Day! Time To 'Buy The News?
us.content: We've been selling the rumor of higher tariffs and a worsening trade war for weeks. Ever since the markets peaked in February, the averages got smacked hard enough to push the S&P 500 into an “official” correction - down 10% from its peak.

us.title: TX Rail Products, Inc. Secures Credit Line Expansion at Attractive Terms to Accelerate Growth
us.content: ASHLAND, Ky., April 02, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- TX Rail Products, Inc. (OTC Markets PINK: TXRP), a supplier of rail and rail products to the U.S. coal mining industry, short line railroads and tunneling contractors, today announced the signing of increasing the Line of Credit with its existing lender to support its growth strategy.

us.title: Circle's IPO Reveals Coinbase Earns More From USDC Despite Explosive Growth
us.content: Cryptocurrency firm Circle has revealed surprising insights in its recent IPO filingCoinbase earns more from USD Coin (USDC) than Circle itself. Circles largest expense in 2024 was a staggering $908 million paid to Coinbase for USDC distribution.

us.title: Staying Focused Through Tariff Uncertainty And Market Jitters
us.content: Uncertainty contributed to a significant sell-off in US stocks last week, especially in technology stocks. While we're seeing headwinds in the US, we're getting some good news in other parts of the world.

us.title: Stagwell (STGW) Appoints John Kahan as Inaugural Chief AI Officer
us.content: Bringing nearly four decades of experience in data and artificial intelligence, Kahan joins Stagwell at a pivotal time for growth at the challenger network NEW YORK , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Stagwell (NASDAQ: STGW), the challenger network built to transform marketing, today announced the appointment of John Kahan as the network's inaugural Chief AI Officer. Reporting into Mark Penn, Stagwell Chairman and CEO, Kahan will spearhead the integration and development of artificial intelligence across Stagwell's global network.

us.title: Workplace Uniform Maker UniFirst Tops Q2 Profit Forecasts; Sales Come in Short
us.content: UniFirst (UNF) on Wednesday reported better fiscal 2025 second-quarter profit than analysts had expected, but sales fell just short.

us.title: Hain Celestial Expands Reach of Better-For-You Snacks to Dollar General
us.content: Manufacturer's channel expansion unlocks new opportunities to reach a broader consumer base, enhance market presence HOBOKEN, N.J. , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Embracing its "first to mind, first to find" approach, The Hain Celestial Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: HAIN), a leading global health and wellness company whose purpose is to inspire healthier living through better-for-you brands, is increasing access to its snack offerings by making them available at Dollar General stores.

us.title: USDC Payments Accepted by Sony Electronics Singapore Through Crypto.com Partnership
us.content: Sony Electronics Singapore has announced the acceptance of USDC stablecoin payments through a partnership with Crypto.com.

us.title: Former U.S. Trade Rep. Ron Kirk on Trump tariffs: We've decided to start a trade war with the world
us.content: Former U.S. Trade Representative Ron Kirk joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss President Trump's tariff announcement today, impact of tariffs on the American consumer, using tariffs as a negotiating tactic, and more.

us.title: Japan's SMBC Plans Stablecoin Development With Ava Labs Collaboration
us.content: Japan's Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC), the nation's second-largest bank, is set to explore the launch of its own stablecoin.

us.title: Rivian starts a challenging year with a big slip in deliveries
us.content: Rivian delivered just 8,640 vehicles in the first three months of 2024, the company's worst quarterly mark since the end of 2022. But the company says the slow start won't impact its overall guidance for the year — it still expects to deliver between 46,000 and 51,000 EVs by the end of 2025.

us.title: Top-Performing Foreign ETFs of Q1
us.content: International ETFs outperformed Wall Street in Q1 of 2025.

us.title: DXC Names Anders Lange as Chief Procurement Officer
us.content: ASHBURN, Va. , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ - DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC), a leading Fortune 500 global technology services provider, has appointed Anders Lange as Chief Procurement Officer, effective immediately.

france.title: Pi Network News: 125K Sellers at PiFest, Yet Pi Coin Nears All-Time Lows After 60% Drop
france.content: The Pi Network's Pi token has plunged below the $0.70 mark, now just a few cents shy of its all-time low of $0.6152. This sharp decline comes after the token lost 77% of its value since peaking at $2.98 in February, leaving investors questioning the future of their holdings.

france.title: Clorox: Stable Revenue And Strong Dividend Program, But Too Expensive
france.content: Clorox is considered recession-proof due to its essential products and strong brand, but its shares are too expensive, given its profitability. CLX has underperformed the market significantly, facing competition and changing consumer preferences, which limits its growth and profitability. Despite stable revenue, CLX's high operating costs and declining margins make it less attractive compared to tech giants with better growth prospects.

france.title: Domino’s Pizza (NYSE: DPZ) Expands Delivery Reach with DoorDash Partnership
france.content:
Domino’s Pizza (NYSE: DPZ) has partnered with DoorDash (NASDAQ: DASH) to allow customers to place orders via the DoorDash app, while still ensuring deliveries are fulfilled by Domino’s own drivers.

Key Highlights of the Deal

  • Pilot Program: Currently active in select U.S. locations.

  • Full U.S. Rollout: Slated for May 2025.

  • Canada Expansion: Expected later in 2025.

  • Delivery Control: Orders placed on DoorDash will still be handled by Domino’s in-house drivers.

Market Impact & Business Strategy

By leveraging DoorDash’s massive customer base, Domino’s aims to expand its reach while maintaining control over its delivery infrastructure. This strategy could help drive higher order volumes and enhanced revenue growth.

Financial Insights

Investors tracking Domino’s financial health can access real-time data through the Key Metrics API to analyze trends in revenue growth, profit margins, and operational efficiency.

france.title: Why Trump Likes Tariffs: To Fund US Tax Cuts, or Negotiate Trade?
france.content: Trump is due to reveal his tariff plans in the White House Rose Garden just as US markets close on Wednesday. Several proposals are said to be under consideration, including a tiered tariff system with a set of flat rates for countries, as well as a more customized reciprocal plan.

france.title: Mohamed El-Erian Says Markets Haven't Priced a 50-50 Tariff Destination
france.content: Mohamed El-Erian, Queens' College Cambridge president and Bloomberg Opinion columnist, says he worries “about the soft data becoming market reality, becoming hard data reality,” as he examines how markets are anticipating the impact of President Donald Trump's tariff policy. His opinions are his own.

france.title: The Aussie is losing its way as markets' risk compass
france.content: The Australian dollar's surprising resilience in the face of the hit to market sentiment from U.S. tariffs is raising questions whether its long-standing role as a proxy for risk is ending.

france.title: A. O. Smith to Hold First Quarter Conference Call on April 29, 2025
france.content: MILWAUKEE , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- A. O. Smith Corporation (NYSE: AOS) will release its first quarter 2025 financial results before the market opens on Tuesday, April 29, and has scheduled an investor conference call to follow at 10:00 a.m.

france.title: Boockvar: The market is transitioning—throw the old blueprint in the garbage
france.content: Peter Boockvar, CIO at Bleakley Financial Group, warns tariffs could destabilize markets. He sees a shift from Mag 7 stocks to international and value investing.

france.title: SOUN Investors Have Opportunity to Lead SoundHound AI, Inc. Securities Fraud Lawsuit with the Schall Law Firm
france.content: LOS ANGELES , April 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- The Schall Law Firm , a national shareholder rights litigation firm, reminds investors of a class action lawsuit against SoundHound AI, Inc. ("SoundHound" or "the Company") (NASDAQ: SOUN) for violations of §§10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Investors who purchased the Company's securities between May 10, 2024 and March 3, 2025, inclusive (the "Class Period"), are encouraged to contact the firm before May 27, 2025.

france.title: First Mid Bancshares, Inc. to Announce First Quarter 2025 Results on April 30
france.content: MATTOON, Ill., April 02, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- First Mid Bancshares, Inc. (NASDAQ: FMBH) (the “Company”) announced today that it intends to issue its first quarter 2025 financial results after market close on Wednesday, April 30, 2025. Along with the press release announcing the financial results, the Company will publish an investor presentation and make it available via the investor relations section of its website.
